title: Shunra Network Virtualization for Hewlett-Packard toServerObject() Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Hewlett-Packard Network Visualization. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. 
The specific flaw exists within the toServerObject function.  The method does not properly sanitize the input to this function allowing for directory traversal. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to write files under the context of SYSTEM and achieve remote code execution.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett-Packard has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04374202
timeline:
2014-04-08 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2014-07-24 - Coordinated public release of advisory
